title: Code of Conduct
text: committed fostering environment diversity, inclusion, respect valued celebrated. believe everyone, regardless race, gender identity, sexual orientation, ability, religion, background, feel safe, respected, empowered. community thrives diverse perspectives welcomed embraced.

title: Code of Conduct
text: participants data science project expected : Treat others kindness, empathy, respect. Engage constructive professional discussions. Use inclusive language mindful others’ experiences. Respect differing viewpoints provide constructive feedback. Adhere best coding practices, document work clearly, collaborate effectively. Properly attribute sources avoid plagiarism.

title: Code of Conduct
text: Unacceptable behaviours include, limited : Harassment, discrimination, intimidation kind. Offensive inappropriate comments regarding race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, disability. Bullying, threats, violence. Unethical dishonest behavior, including falsification results misrepresentation data. want make sure project safe space hope able use best judegement acceptable unacceptable behaviour

title: Code of Conduct
text: Unacceptable behaviour tolerated circumstances. Consequences may include: warning. Temporary permanent suspension project contributions. Removal project repository. Reporting GitHub violations terms service.

what: Group 16's bike data set prediction package
title: Group 16's bike data set prediction package
text: goal predict.bike provide workflow bike data set analysis. predict.bike R package streamlines analysis prediction bikeshare usage using clean, reproducible workflow. Designed accessibility mind, ideal learners data science beginners looking practice data cleaning, modeling, visualization real-world dataset. flexible frameworks like caret tidymodels offer broader applicability, predict.bike focuses single problem makes easy understand step typical ML pipeline.

title: Group 16's bike data set prediction package
text: predict.bike sits within broader R ecosystem machine learning data science packages. powerful tools like caret, randomForest, tidymodels offer highly customizable workflows, predict.bike lightweight, beginner-friendly alternative tailored specific problem dataset. allows users focus logic structure data analysis pipeline without needing configure every modeling component.

title: Group 16's bike data set prediction package
text: can install development version predict.bike GitHub :

title: Group 16's bike data set prediction package
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(predict.bike)  # Load and clean raw data bike_data <- read.csv("data/raw/bike_data.csv") cleaned_data <- clean_bike_data(bike_data)  # Split data and train model split <- split_data(cleaned_data) model <- train_bike_model(split$train)  # Evaluate on test set evaluate_model(model, split$test)  # Create a custom scatter plot scatter <- make_scatter(cleaned_data, x = "temp", y = "cnt",                         title = "Bike Rentals vs Temp", xlab = "Temperature",                         ylab = "Count", color = "steelblue") print(scatter)  # Create a custom bar plot bar <- make_bar(cleaned_data, x = "season", y = "cnt", fill = "season",                 title = "Bike Rentals by Season", xlab = "Season",                 ylab = "Total Count", xlabels = c("1", "2", "3", "4")) print(bar)  # Save the plot save_plot("scatter_plot.png", output_file = "output/plots", width = 8)

title: Group 16's bike data set prediction package
text: clean_bike_data(): Preprocesses raw bikeshare data split_data(): Splits data training test sets train_bike_model(): Trains Random Forest model evaluate_model(): Evaluates model accuracy predictions make_scatter(): Generates customizable scatter plots make_bar(): Creates bar plots label fill options save_plot(): Saves plot specified output path

title: Clean Bike Data — clean_bike_data
text: function cleans raw bike-sharing dataset removing unnecessary columns, renaming ID column, converting selected columns correct data types.

title: Clean Bike Data — clean_bike_data
text: data data frame tibble containing raw bike data.

title: Clean Bike Data — clean_bike_data
text: cleaned data frame tibble : instant dteday columns removed weathersit converted factor cnt converted numeric X column renamed id

title: Clean Bike Data — clean_bike_data
code: data <- data.frame(X = 1:2, instant = 1:2, dteday = c("2021-01-01", "2021-01-02"),                      weathersit = c(1, 2), cnt = c("100", "200")) clean_bike_data(data) #>   id weathersit cnt #> 1  1          1 100 #> 2  2          2 200

title: Evaluate Regression Model Performance — evaluate_model
text: Calculates model performance metrics predictions test data.

title: Evaluate Regression Model Performance — evaluate_model
text: model fitted model object (train_bike_model()) test_data Test dataset evaluation (data.frame tibble) response_var Character string naming response variable column

title: Evaluate Regression Model Performance — evaluate_model
text: list containing: rmse Root mean squared error (numeric) predictions Data frame actual predicted values

title: Evaluate Regression Model Performance — evaluate_model
code: data <- data.frame(x = rnorm(100), y = rnorm(100)) model <- train_bike_model(data, y ~ x) results <- evaluate_model(model, data, "y") #> Warning: NaNs produced

title: Create a bar plot — make_bar
text: Creates bar plot given data, x, y fill title/labels want

title: Create a bar plot — make_bar
code: make_bar(data, x, y, fill, title, xlab, ylab, xlabels)

title: Create a bar plot — make_bar
text: data data frame x variable data param want x-axis y variable data param want y-axis fill variable bars fill title title plot xlab label x-axis ylab label y-axis xlabels Labels variables x-axis

title: Create a bar plot — make_bar
text: bar ggplot

title: Create a bar plot — make_bar
code: data_frame <- data.frame(x = c(1,2,3,4,5), y = c(5,6,7,8,9)) make_bar(data_frame, "x", "y", "x", "My Bar Plot", "X-axis",  "Y-axis", xlabels = c("1", "2","3", "4", "5"))

title: Create a scatter plot — make_scatter
text: Creates scatter plot given data, x, y color/title/labels choice

title: Create a scatter plot — make_scatter
code: make_scatter(data, x, y, title, xlab, ylab, color)

title: Create a scatter plot — make_scatter
text: data data frame x variable data param want x-axis y variable data param want y-axis title title plot xlab label x-axis ylab label y-axis color color want points

title: Create a scatter plot — make_scatter
text: scatter ggplot

title: Create a scatter plot — make_scatter
code: data_frame <- data.frame(x = c(1,2,3,4,5), y = c(5,6,7,8,9)) make_scatter(data_frame, "x", "y", "My Scatter Plot", "X-axis", "Y-axis", "Blue")

title: Save a plot made — save_plot
text: Saves plot path, width name

title: Save a plot made — save_plot
text: name name want plot output_file file go width width plot

title: Save a plot made — save_plot
code: directory <- tempdir() save_plot("test_plot.png", directory, 10 ) #> Saving 10 x 7 in image

what: Split Data into Training and Test Sets — split_data
title: Split Data into Training and Test Sets — split_data
text: Partitions dataset training testing subsets using random sampling. Maintains proportional class distribution strata specified.

title: Split Data into Training and Test Sets — split_data
Split Data into Training and Test Sets — split_data
text: data data frame tibble containing dataset split prop Numeric value 0 1 indicating proportion data training set (default: 0.75)

title: Split Data into Training and Test Sets — split_data
text: list two components: train Training subset (data.frame) test Testing subset (data.frame)

title: Split Data into Training and Test Sets — split_data
code: data <- data.frame(x = rnorm(100), y = rnorm(100)) splits <- split_data(data)

what: Train Linear Regression Model for Bike Counts — train_bike_model
title: Train Linear Regression Model for Bike Counts — train_bike_model
text: Fits linear regression model predict bike rental counts using specified predictor variables.

title: Train Linear Regression Model for Bike Counts — train_bike_model
Train Linear Regression Model for Bike Counts — train_bike_model
text: train_data Training data (data.frame tibble) formula formula specifying model structure (e.g. cnt ~ temp + season)

title: Train Linear Regression Model for Bike Counts — train_bike_model
text: object class "lm" containing fitted model

title: Train Linear Regression Model for Bike Counts — train_bike_model
code: data <- data.frame(x = rnorm(100), y = rnorm(100)) model <- train_bike_model(data, y ~ x)
